name: forth
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(from a place) out or away, or (from a point in time) forward: set forth They set forth on their travels in early June.from that day forth From that day forth he never drank again.
More examplesFewer examplesThe pendulum in the grandfather clock swung back and forth.As we set off into the forest, we felt as though we were venturing forth into the unknown.He tried to calm the screaming baby by rocking it back and forth.The minister opened the door and sallied forth to face the angry crowd.Go forth and multiply!
